page.title: 05FORESTRY
page.content: The second land use in the area is { {FORESTRY.}Approximately 350 hectares of land owned by the FORESTRY COMMISSION lies within this section. The main trees grown are Sitka spruce, Norway spruce,European larch and lodge-pole pine. The forest was first planted in 1930. Since then trees in various stages of growth are tended. First returns on capital outlay are thinnings sold as Christmas trees or contracted out to wood-merchants for the highest bid. Seeds culled in autumn just before the cones open are sent to laboratories to be tested for viability,then sown and reared for two years in nurseries. The two year old plants in this forest however come from America/Canada. A forester can plant about 1000 trees per day.About 240000 trees are planted in the Gartly area per year.
